Key Match Events: Carlos Santana went 3 for 4 with a two-run homer
Others: Ryan Jeffers had two hits and two runs
Cole Sands (8-1) allowed one hit in two scoreless innings
Spencer Steer hit an RBI triple in the fourth and scored on Ty France’s sacrifice fly
Cincinnati Reds’ TJ Friedl hits a single in the fourth inning
Minnesota Twins’ Willi Castro looks on after hitting an RBI single in the fourth inning
Minnesota Twins starting pitcher David Festa gave up two runs, three hits and three walks in 3 2/3 innings
Minnesota (79-70) maintained a 2 1/2-game lead over Detroit and Seattle (both 77-73) for the last AL wild card spot
Minnesota plays at Cleveland on Monday, starting a seven-game trip that ends in Boston
